availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses A. Sweaton (Hardin Co. TN, farmer and pvt 1st KY light artillery)

body.p: Hardin County, Tennessee, farmer and soldier. Mississippi native. Son of Carolina Sweaton. Resident in Hardin County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in 1864. Served in the 1st Kentucky Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as a private from September 10, 1863, to July 26, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Hardin County, District 10, p. 216B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 510.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0148.
"Moses Andres Sweeton (1846-1938)," Find A Grave, accessed November 16, 2020, Memorial #65658186, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65658186.
